This is a chat only number. true false false false false false false false false false Powered By Digit Digit Insurance Explore Spiritual Places in India Temples in Visakhapatnam Switch to Digit Insurance Quick Claim Process Affordable Premium Check Premium Check Premium Top 10 Famous Temples in Visakhapatnam to Visit A divine odyssey through the sacred precincts of Visakhapatnam, a coastal gem nestled on the eastern shores of India. As one traverses this vibrant city, they immerse themselves in the spiritual aura of these renowned temples, each a testament to centuries-old traditions and unwavering devotion. The mystique and reverence surrounding these temples that grace the landscape of Visakhapatnam, beckon pilgrims and travellers alike to bask in their divine radiance. Team Digit Table of Contents Best Temples to Visit in Visakhapatnam Sri Varahalakshmi Narasimha Swami Vari Temple Sri Kanaka Mahalakshmi Temple Sri Kalimata Temple Sri Sampath Vinayaka Temple Sai Baba Temple Sri Venkateswara Swami Temple ISKCON Temple Bellam Vinayakudu Temple Sri Karakachettu Polamamba Temple Madhavadhara Temple Frequently Asked Questions List of Temples in Visakhapatnam Following is the list of temples in Visakhapatnam that are easily accessible via the Visakhapatnam Junction Railway Station, Visakhapatnam International Airport, and the RTC Complex Bus Station (also known as APSTRC Complex): Temples Location Sri Varahalakshmi Narasimha Swami Vari Temple Simhachalam Sri Kanaka Mahalakshmi Temple Burujupeta Sri Kalimata Temple Pandurangapuram Sri Sampath Vinayaka Temple Asilmetta Sai Baba Temple Chinna Waltair Sri Venkateswara Swami Temple Rushikonda ISKCON Temple Rushikonda Bellam Vinayakudu Temple Krishna Nagar Sri Karakachettu Polamamba Temple Pedda Waltair Madhavadhara Temple Kancharapalem 10 Best Temples to Visit in Visakhapatnam Explore the top 10 temples in Visakhapatnam: 1. Sri Varahalakshmi Narasimha Swami Vari Temple | Simhachalam This sacred abode, nestled atop the picturesque hills of Simhachalam, pays homage to Lord Narasimha, an incarnation of Lord Vishnu. The temple's serene ambience and architectural grandeur attract devotees from far and wide. Best Time to Visit: April to January. Temple Timings: Open daily from 6:30 to 11:30 AM, 12:15 PM to 2:30 PM and 3:15 AM to 7:30 PM. Nearby Places: Kailasagiri, Rushikonda Beach, Dolphin's Nose. 2. Sri Kanaka Mahalakshmi Temple | Burujpeta Nestled in the heart of Burujupeta, the Kanaka Mahalakshmi Temple is a symbol of prosperity and blessings. Devotees throng here, seeking the benevolence of Goddess Mahalakshmi. One can find solace and spirituality. Best Time to Visit: September to November. Temple Timings: Open daily, 24 hours. Nearby Places: Ramakrishna Beach, INS Kursura Submarine Museum, Visakha Museum. 3. Sri Kali Mata Temple | Pandurangapuram Nestled in the heart of Vizag, the Kali Temple reverberates with the divine presence of Goddess Kali. Devotees and tourists worldwide come here seeking blessings, peace, and protection from the fierce yet compassionate deity. Best Time to Visit: September to November. Temple Timings: Open daily from 8:00 AM to 11:30 AM and 5:00 PM to 8:00 PM. Nearby Places: Submarine Museum, Rama Krishna Beach, Visakha Museum. 4. Sri Sampath Vinayaka Temple | Asilmetta Dedicated to Lord Ganesha, the Sampath Vinayaka Temple in Asilmetta radiates divine blessings and auspiciousness. Its vibrant festivities and serene ambience allure devotees and visitors alike to immerse themselves in tranquillity. Best Time to Visit: August to September. Temple Timings: Open daily from 5:30 AM to 10:30 AM and 5:30 PM to 8:00 PM. Nearby Places: RK Beach, Dolphin's Nose, Kailasagiri. 5. Sai Baba Temple | Chinna Waltair Situated in Chinna Waltair, the Sai Baba Temple, dedicated to Shri Sai Baba of Shirdi, is a haven of peace and solace for devotees. Its serene ambience and divine presence offer spiritual upliftment and solace to all who visit. Best Time to Visit: July to September. Temple Timings: Open daily from 6:30 AM to 12:00 PM and 5:30 PM to 8:30 PM. Nearby Places: Rama Krishna Beach, INS Kursura Submarine Museum, Visakha Museum. 6. Sri Venkateswara Swamy Temple | Rushikonda Dedicated to Lord Venkateswara, this temple in Rushikonda exudes divine grace and tranquillity. Its towering gopuram and intricate carvings narrate tales of devotion and spirituality. Devotees and tourists can find an aura of serenity here. Best Time to Visit: September to January. Temple Timings: Open daily from 6:00 AM to 8:00 PM. Nearby Places: Rushikonda Beach, Kailasagiri, Dolphin's Nose. 7. ISKCON Temple | Rushikonda Nestled amidst the scenic beauty of Rushikonda, the ISKCON Temple is a place of peace and spirituality. Its vibrant festivities and soul-stirring chants during pooja or rituals offer immense solace to devotees and visitors alike. Best Time to Visit: August to October. Temple Timings: Open daily from 4:30 AM to 8:30 PM (closes at 10:00 PM on Sunday). Nearby Places: Rushikonda Beach, Kailasagiri, INS Kursura Submarine Museum. 8. Bellam Vinayakudu Temple | Krishna Nagar Located in the heart of Krishna Nagar, the Bellam Vinayakudu Temple radiates divine blessings and a spiritual aura. Devotees visit here seeking the benevolence of Lord Ganesha, the remover of obstacles. One can find themselves in serenity. Best Time to Visit: August and September. Temple Timings: 6:00 AM to 11:30 AM and 5:00 PM to 8:00 PM. Nearby Places: Kailasagiri, RK Beach, Submarine Museum. 9. Sri Karaka Chettu Polamamba Temple | Pedda Waltair Situated amidst the tranquil surroundings of Pedda Waltair, the Sri Karakachettu Polamba Temple exudes divine grace and spiritual bliss. Devotees flock here to find tranquillity and to seek blessings from the revered deity. Best Time to Visit: May to December. Temple Timings: 6:00 AM to 12:00 PM and 5:30 PM to 8:30 PM. Nearby Places: Ramakrishna Beach, INS Kursura Submarine Museum, Visakha Museum. 10. Madhavadhara Temple | Kancharapalem Nestled amidst the quaint environs of Kancharapalem, the Madhavadhara Temple stands as a testament to divine grace and spirituality. One can come here and seek solace, immerse in peace, and receive blessings from Madhava Swamy. Best Time to Visit: December to March. Temple Timings: 6:00 AM to 11:30 AM and 5:30 PM to 8:30 PM. Nearby Places: Simhachalam Temple, Kailasagiri, Rushikonda Beach. Through the divine landscape of Visakhapatnam, we are reminded of the enduring allure and timeless appeal of its sacred temples. Each temple, steeped in history, tradition, and devotion, offers a sanctuary for the weary soul and a beacon of hope for the faithful. Whether seeking solace, blessings, or simply a moment of tranquillity, these revered shrines welcome pilgrims and travellers. Yes, photography for personal use is allowed inside the temple premises. However, it is advised to seek permission before capturing images of any rituals or deity statues. Yes, photography for personal use is allowed inside the temple premises. However, it is advised to seek permission before capturing images of any rituals or deity statues. Are there any specific dress codes to be followed while visiting the Sampath Vinayaka Temple in Asilmetta? While there is no strict dress code, it is recommended to dress modestly out of respect for the religious sanctity of the temple. Avoid wearing revealing or inappropriate attire. While there is no strict dress code, it is recommended to dress modestly out of respect for the religious sanctity of the temple. Avoid wearing revealing or inappropriate attire. Can non-Hindus visit the Kanaka Mahalakshmi Temple in Burujupeta? Yes, the Kanaka Mahalakshmi Temple welcomes visitors of all faiths to experience its divine ambience and seek blessings. Non-Hindus are allowed to participate in darshans and rituals conducted at the temple. Yes, the Kanaka Mahalakshmi Temple welcomes visitors of all faiths to experience its divine ambience and seek blessings. Non-Hindus are allowed to participate in darshans and rituals conducted at the temple. Which temple is the most famous in Visakhapatnam? Lord Vishnu in the form of a man-lion resides in the most well-known temple in Vizag, Simhachalan Temple, which is also among the richest and most exquisitely sculpted shrines. Lord Vishnu in the form of a man-lion resides in the most well-known temple in Vizag, Simhachalan Temple, which is also among the richest and most exquisitely sculpted shrines. Which god is famous in Vizag? In Visakhapatnam (Vizag), the most famous deity is Sri Varaha Lakshmi Narasimha Swamy. In Visakhapatnam (Vizag), the most famous deity is Sri Varaha Lakshmi Narasimha Swamy. How many steps to climb Simhachalam Temple? The flight of one thousand stairs from the foot of the hill, whose entrance is known as the Bhairava Dwaram in Simachalan Temple. The flight of one thousand stairs from the foot of the hill, whose entrance is known as the Bhairava Dwaram in Simachalan Temple. What is famous in Visakhapatnam’s Temples for shopping? Visakhapatnam is known for its traditional handicrafts, textiles, and local products. Kondapalli toys, Etikoppaka wooden products, and Lepakshi paintings are among the most popular items to buy near Visakhapatnam’s Temples. Visakhapatnam is known for its traditional handicrafts, textiles, and local products. Kondapalli toys, Etikoppaka wooden products, and Lepakshi paintings are among the most popular items to buy near Visakhapatnam’s Temples. What is Visakhapatnam famous for? Visakhapatnam, often called Vizag, is famous for its beautiful beaches, scenic landscapes, bustling port, and vibrant culture. It is also renowned for its ancient temples. Visakhapatnam, often called Vizag, is famous for its beautiful beaches, scenic landscapes, bustling port, and vibrant culture. It is also renowned for its ancient temples. Who is the goddess of Visakhapatnam? Sri Kanaka Mahalakshmi Ammaavaru is said to be the family deity of Visakhapatnam's royal families. Sri Kanaka Mahalakshmi Ammaavaru is said to be the family deity of Visakhapatnam's royal families. Where did Visakhapatnam acquire its name from? Visakhapatnam’s name was derived from Visakha, the Hindu god of valour. Visakhapatnam’s name was derived from Visakha, the Hindu god of valour. Are there any temples with unique architecture in Visakhapatnam? The ISKCON Temple in Rushikonda, Visakhapatnam, stands out for its unique and modern architectural design, blending traditional elements with contemporary styles. The ISKCON Temple in Rushikonda, Visakhapatnam, stands out for its unique and modern architectural design, blending traditional elements with contemporary styles.
